meanings.definition: A loose outer garment worn over armor.
meanings.sent1: The knight proudly wore his surcoat over his shiny armor.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design on the surcoat of the medieval warrior.
meanings.sent3: The surcoat danced in the wind as the knight rode into battle.
meanings.sent4: Her surcoat of bravery shielded her from the harsh realities of the world.
meanings.sent5: The surcoat fluttered like a flag of honor on the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with a surcoat.
meanings.sent1: He decided to surcoat the fragile book with a protective layer.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully surcoated the delicate plant to shield it from the frost.
meanings.sent3: She surcoated her heart with love to guard against negativity.
meanings.sent4: The artist surcoated the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing it to life.
meanings.sent5: The warm embrace of friendship surcoated her soul with comfort.
